contentList.content:
Sorry, your config isn't compatible
with the current mod version installed.

Sorry, your config isn't compatible
with the current mod version installed
and can't be upgraded.

Type !VoreConfigReset in the console or
delete your config manually to reset your config
and stop this popup from appearing.
Allows you to give or take predator abilities from others.
Everything you need to eat and be eaten!
You can swallow other creatures whole... but now you're so hungry...
Smells acidic... You're not sure you should drink it...
Grants you the ability to swallow your foes whole.
Grants you the ability to shove yourself down someone's throat.
Smells like testing... You're not sure you should drink it...
Grants you free casts of all the spells.
Smells like testing... You're not sure you should drink it...
Grants you free casts of all the spells.
One swig and you're good to go.
Renders you unable to be eaten by others.
Swallow a creature whole, sending them to your Stomach.
Swallow a creature whole, sending them to your Ass.
Swallow a creature whole, sending them to your Womb.
Swallow a creature whole, sending them to your Cock.
Marks you as able to Orally vore other creatures.
Marks you as able to Anally vore other creatures.
Marks you as able to Unbirth other creatures.
Marks you as able to Cock vore other creatures.
Swallow a creature whole, attempting to digest them.
Flex and massage your belly, causing every lethally swallowed prey to take [1] and [2].
Releases all of your living or fully digested prey from your stomach.
Releases all of your living or fully digested prey from your ass.
Releases all of your living or fully digested prey from your womb.
Releases all of your living or fully digested prey from your balls.
Releases a living or fully digested prey from your [1] at random.
Devour an [1], storing them in your [2]
You are being digested! You take [1] per turn.
The size of your belly slows you down.
This represents the weight of the prey you're carrying.
This is in your stomach, you can't drop it.
Absorbs all of your fully digested prey, adding their items to your inventory.
It's already too late for them...
Your swallowed items are stored here
Your stomach's feeling agitated. If this reaches [1], you'll regurgitate everything that's still moving!
Fill your stomach with acid. You will start digesting all your living prey! Using this again will stop the lethal digestion.
Fill your intestines with acid. You will start digesting all your living prey! Using this again will stop the lethal digestion.
Fill your womb with acid. You will start digesting all your living prey! Using this again will stop the lethal digestion.
Fill your balls with acid. You will start digesting all your living prey! Using this again will stop the lethal digestion.
You you just got one down, it'd be a struggle to get another. Wait a bit before swallowing new prey.
You feel sick after regurgitating all of your prey. Wait a bit before swallowing new prey.
You are being swallowed by the pred!
Shove yourself down a character's throat. It's up to them whether to digest you or not.
While most fear being eaten, you relish it
You are feeling slightly hungry. Your wisdom and constitution are reduced by [1]. There is a low chance you will randomly start digesting your prey.
You feel hungry. Your wisdom, constitution, strength are reduced by [1]. There is a medium chance you will randomly start digesting your endo prey.
You are starving. Your wisdom, constitution, strength, intelligence are reduced by [1]. You can no longer keep your stomach acids at bay, all endo attemts will result in lethal vore.
Once this reaches a certain limit, you will loose your ability to struggle in any way
You possess the ability to swallow creatures far larger than your body would betray. While not apparent at a glance, in you lies a hunger that frightens you as much as it excites you.
You do not possess the ability to swallow others whole.
Predators are unable to be devour you.
You have made a pact with an unspeakably ancient entity, but with great power comes great hunger - it is up to you how to utilise it.

When trying to Lethally Swallow a creature, you will use your Intimidation if it's higher that your Athletics or Acrobatics for the rolls. The pact made your body stronger, allowing you to wear Medium Armor and use shields.
Your <LSTag Tooltip="CarryWeight">carrying capacity</LSTag> is increased 1.5 times.
When you digest a prey, you regain a spell slot.

When an enemy attacks you while you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SP_Stuffed">Stuffed</LSTag>, you can use your reaction to meet their gaze and let them feel your hunger, making them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag> until the end of their next turn.

The eldritch power protects you in battle, so you can consume more prey in it's name. Your AC is increased by 1 and you take 2 less damage from all sources when <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SP_Stuffed">Stuffed</LSTag>.
Your flesh is filled with eldritch power, giving you immunity to indigestion.

Your gain the ability to bind a single allied endoed prey to yourself. Your action and bonus action points are increased by 1, but you cannot swallow or regurgitate anyone (including bound pred) until long rest, and the prey cannot perform any actions.
Your draw strength from prey bound to you.
Your are bound to your predator and unable to do anything.
Your patron bestows a gift upon you for your loyal service. Channel your voracious power into one of these boons.
You can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="SP_SC_ShieldOfGluttony">Shield</LSTag> without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> (once per short rest)
You made an oath to protect the ones you care about, and to keep them close. What could be closer than inside of you?

Devoured party members weigh half as much, and increase your defensive abilities instead of hindering them. Each ally you carry safely inside of you grants a +[1] bonus to AC and Saving Throws, and [2] at the start of each of your turns.

Devoured allies are now weightless, and increase your defensive abilities even more. Each ally you carry safely inside of you grants a +[1] bonus to AC and Saving Throws, and [2] at the start of each of your turns.
Protecting your allies inside you grants you a +[1] bonus to AC and Saving Throws, and [2] at the start of each of your turns for each one.
Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> is replaced with an uncomprimising calm, focusing on defense as well as offense. While it is active, you have resistance to all damage.
You quell the rage within you to better protect your allies.

Deals an additional [1] damage with melee and improvised weapons, and while throwing objects.

Also has Resistance to all damage, and Advantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.

Cannot cast or concentrate on spells.

When faced with trials, you may utilize the talents of your allies to assist you. When making an ability check, if an ally inside you has a higher bonus to that check, you may use their bonus instead.
Your Strength and Constitution are increased by [1] each for each ally you have inside of you.
You have [1] temporary HP for each ally inside of you.
Allies inside you have a +2 to attack rolls and their spall save DC.
You have a +2 to attack rolls and their spall save DC.
Doubles your stomach capacity. Gain the ability to perform Anal Vore.
Increase digestion damage by 1d4 and Proficiency Bonus, and you ignore acid resistance of your prey. You are satiated by digesting non-organic creatures. Gain the ability to perform Cock Vore
All damage dealt to you by creatures in your stomach is halved. You gain advantage against the struggles of your prey.
You can devour significantly more prey without suffering debuffs. When you have 3 or more prey inside, you gain advantage on intimidation, 1 AC, and 2 damage reduction from all sources.
You have Advantage on Intimidation checks, +[1] AC, and [2] damage reduction from all sources .
Endoed prey are not blinded and can use spells. You do not break concentration of willing prey when you swallow them.
You gain advantage for swallowing prey. You can fully swallow your prey with one less use of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="SP_SwallowDown">Continue swallowing</LSTag> (minimum 0).
Your hunger is satisfied by resting with a prey inside you. Gain the ability to perform Unbirth. Gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="SP_Shout_HealingAcid_U">Medicinal Acids (Unbirth)</LSTag>.

While inside of another predator, you have advantage on all checks made to devour another creature, and each time they devour another creature into the same location, you may immediately attempt to swallow that creature.
You gain advantage when struggling and you are not knocked Prone when regurgitated. Gain resistance to damage dealt by acid.
You gain the ability to heal your predator pred once per short rest. You are not blinded or restrained while endoed, and you can target characters with spells outside on the pred.
Your take twice as much space inside a pred. On struggling success, you knock predator Prone for 1 round.
Once per long rest you can massage the belly of a pred, and all the lethal vored prey inside the pred will immediately take digestion damage and pred's indigestion will be reduced to zero.
You are not restrained or blinded when swallowed by any pred. Gain advantage against your pred.
Continue swallow your prey down your throat. If you don't swallow them in time, they will escape!
Turns a character into a predator or prey.
Ask your predator to release you.
Use this if the player character is swallowed and you want a long rest. You must quickly click YES, or this will not work
You attempt to whet your appetite on the taste of a nearby creature. On a hit, the target takes [1]. For the next 2 turns the Swallow attempts you make against the target are made with Advantage.
You slam your belly into a character, dealing [1] per prey inside you.
You point at a creature within range, altering it's natural flavor.
A creature of your choice within range becomes irresistably delicious to any predator. That creature has Disadvantage on checks to avoid being Swallowed.
A creature of your choice within range becomes disgusting in flavor to any predator. That creature has Advantage on checks to avoid being Swallowed.

You may only cast this spell if you contain at least 1 prey in your stomach. You emanate a thunderous burp in front of you. Each creature within range must make a Constitution saving throw or take [1] per prey inside you.
You briefly turn your skin into a smooth, acid resistant shell, gaining resistance to Acid damage for 2 turns.
You touch one target creature with a creature inside of them. Their body compresses itself until it appears that they have no creatures inside of them.
You touch one target creature. For the duration of the spell, their stomach capacity is increased by a third.

Your tongue flies out like a whip, entangling and dragging a creature towards you. A creature in range must make a Strength Saving throw or be pulled up closer to the spellcaster. On success, you automatically make an attempt to swallow it. If the target is not an enemy, you will try to endo it.
You choose a creature, fooling their body into thinking that they are starving. For the duration of the spell, they have advantage on all checks made to grapple or devour another creature.
You swiftly whisk a friendly creature out of harms way, depositing them safely inside you. Fails if you select a vore type you can't do.
You swiftly whisk a friendly creature out of harms way, depositing them safely inside your stomach. Fails if you select a vore type you can't do.
You swiftly whisk a friendly creature out of harms way, depositing them safely inside your ass. Fails if you select a vore type you can't do.
You swiftly whisk a friendly creature out of harms way, depositing them safely inside your womb. Fails if you select a vore type you can't do.
You swiftly whisk a friendly creature out of harms way, depositing them safely inside your balls. Fails if you select a vore type you can't do.
Has a longer range at higher levels.
Fill a target's stomach with burning acid, dealing [1] damage to all of the prey they are digesting.

Your magic forces a predator to disgorge their prey. When you cast this spell against a target that has prey in its stomach, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they regurgitate all creatures from their stomach. If the target has not swallowed any prey, they are instead poisoned for 1 turn.

You touch 1 friendly creature with another creature inside it, granting the predator the ability to excrete healing acids. The predator stops digesting their prey, and each round, all prey within the predator regain [1].
You stop digesting your unbirthed prey, and each round, all prey within the your womb regain [1].
You touch a creature. For the duration of the spell, whenever they inflict digestion damage, they regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

You touch a creature, willing a single creature inside of them into stillness. This prey is incapacitated and immune to all digestion damage for the duration of the spell. Does not affect prey who are swallowed after this spell is cast.

You touch a creature, willing the creatures inside of them into stillness. All prey are incapacitated and immune to all digestion damage for the duration of the spell. Does not affect prey who are swallowed after this spell is cast.

Your speak a word of power that can transport a creature with less than [1] <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>. They are instantly teleported to the stomach of another creature of your choice within range. That creature is unable to meaningfully struggle for the next hour.

With a single touch, you make a pred's belly rapidly boil through it's prey. All creatures inside of the predator's stomach immediately take [1] and [2], and all the dead prey are immediately fully digested.

You consume a corpse of a humanoid and store it inside you. Your body slowly reconstructs the body of a creature. After some time, you release the humanoid, fully formed and healthy. If weight gain is enabled, this spells will drain your fat to reconstruct the body of the prey.

You consume a corpse of a humanoid and store it inside your stomach. Your body slowly reconstructs the body of a creature. After some time, you release the humanoid, fully formed and healthy. If weight gain is enabled, this spells will drain your fat to reconstruct the body of the prey.

You consume a corpse of a humanoid and store it inside your ass. Your body slowly reconstructs the body of a creature. After some time, you release the humanoid, fully formed and healthy. If weight gain is enabled, this spells will drain your fat to reconstruct the body of the prey.

You consume a corpse of a humanoid and store it inside your womb. Your body slowly reconstructs the body of a creature. After some time, you release the humanoid, fully formed and healthy. If weight gain is enabled, this spells will drain your fat to reconstruct the body of the prey.

You consume a corpse of a humanoid and store it inside your balls. Your body slowly reconstructs the body of a creature. After some time, you release the humanoid, fully formed and healthy. If weight gain is enabled, this spells will drain your fat to reconstruct the body of the prey.

You release an earth-shattering belch. All creatures caught in the range of the cone must make a Strength saving throw. On a fail, each creature is knocked prone and takes [1] and [2], that increases with the amount of stuffed stacks you have. On a success, creatures take half damage and are not knocked prone.
You touch a creature, bestowing upon them an insatiable hunger, and more room inside them than they could ever fill.
Teleport [1] target[2] directly into you and start digesting them
Teleport several targets directly into you, and start digesting them
Send the creatures that failed their saves into the predator.
Send the creatures that were targeted by Power Word Swallow into the predator.
Send the creatures that failed their saves into the predator's stomach.
Send the creatures that failed their saves into the predator's ass.
Send the creatures that failed their saves into the predator's womb.
Send the creatures that failed their saves into the predator's balls.
Send the creatures that were targeted by Power Word Swallow into the predator's stomach.
Send the creatures that were targeted by Power Word Swallow into the predator's ass.
Send the creatures that were targeted by Power Word Swallow into the predator's womb.
Send the creatures that were targeted by Power Word Swallow into the predator's balls.
Predators have an Advantage when trying to swallow this character.
Predators have a Disadvantage when trying to swallow this character.
It appears as if this predator has no prey inside them.
Your stomach capacity is increased by a third.
You feel like you could eat the whole world!
Targeted by a bellyport spell; it's too late for them...
You have advantage on all swallow checks
You heal for half of the digestion damage you deal
One prey inside this character is stilled
All preys inside this character are stilled
This prey is incapacitated and cannot act
It feels like you're about to burst! Tou take [1] every turn
Characters in this locus will take digestion damage
Targeted by Power Word Swallow; it's too late for them...
Adds vore-enabling items to the currently controlled character
Dead prey are digested twice as fast if you have 'Boiling insides' feat.
Determines by how much the weight of a prey who is being digested is reduced after a long rest
Determines by how much the weight of a prey who is being digested is reduced after each short rest
You will passively digest dead prey by this much per X turns (set with Gradual Digestion Turns option). Set to 0 to disable.
How often passive digestion happens. 1 turn = 6 real seconds. Set to 0 to disable.
If true, you lose weight immediately upon finishing digestion, and you will be immediately able to absorb / dispose of prey
Enables hunger system for party member preds. If a pred does not digest prey for a long time, they will receive debuffs. Setting this to false disables hunger completely.
Stacks of hunger at which you are hungry.
Stacks of hunger at which you are extremely hungry.
Stacks of hunger at which you are desperately hungry.
Hunger stacks gained on long rest.
The amount of satiation required to reduce your hunger by 1 stack. A bigger value means you require more prey to sastiate your hunger.
How much satiation you get from digestion. This number is a percentage of the value of Digestion Rate (Long Rest)
Hunger stacks gained on short rest.
If set to true, as you gain Hunger, it will become increasingly likely that you'll accidentally start digesting your non-lethally swallowed prey. Works independently from SwitchEndoLethal.

If true, devouring prey can push you over your maximum carrying capacity, but you'll take damage every round proportional to how overstuffed you are. If false, you'll be hard-capped by your carrying capacity.
If true, certain feats will unlock new loci for vore. Otherwise, they can only be added through the potions.
If true, special types of vore will require you to have a body part that would enable that type of vore.
You are able to stop digesting prey with Toggle Lethal spell or by Endoing another prey. If this is off, you will only be able to switch back to endo if no prey are being digested in this locus.
Succecssfully swallowing a creature requires 2 actions, not 1. (WIP)
Prey will be detached from the world grid when swallowed. This means they will be unaffected by AoEs and surfaces, but unable to cast shout spells.
Number of levels of Indigestion at which a pred will be forced to regurgitate all of their prey. Set to 0 to disable.
Number of levels of Exhaustion at which a prey will be exhausted and stop struggling. Set to 0 to disable. (WIP)
Indigestion is removed only on rest
Instead of being removed when there is no living prey inside of a pred, indigestion will ONLY be removed on long rest. Use with high indigestion limit.
Limits the probability of a medium creature being chosen as a pred to this value. Set to 100 or higher to disable.
Limits the probability of a small creature being chosen as a pred to this value. Set to 100 or higher to disable.
Limits the probability of a tiny creature being chosen as a pred to this value. Set to 100 or higher to disable.
Maximum cooldown between NPC vore attempts (in turns).
Minimum cooldown between NPC vore attempts (in turns).
The % of a monster becoming a predator. Monsters are any creature that isn't internally considered Male or Female. This value is multiplied by the race's multiplier. Set to 0 to disable.
The % of a female NPC becoming a predator. Female NPCs have Body Types 1 or 3, with some exceptions. This value is multiplied by the race's multiplier. Set to 0 to disable.
The % of a male NPC becoming a predator. Male NPCs have Body Types 2 or 4, with some exceptions. This value is multiplied by the race's multiplier. Set to 0 to disable.

RaceConfig.json is located in 'AppData\\Local\\Larian Studios\\Baldur's Gate 3\\Script Extender' Race Config stores the % of an NPC of every race becoming a pred. The final chance is 'Race Probability * Sex Probability / 100'% This Resets RaceConfig.json to 100 for every race.
This loads an example race config. Use this if you're too lazy to customize the probabilities yourself, or as a starting point Back up you RaceConfig.json, because this will overwrite it!
Reloads the RaceConfig from the currently saved RaceConfig.json (if it exists) Normally it's loaded when you load a save, but this option allows you to manually reload it.

Preds are unable to regurgitate prey for a number of turn after regurgitation. Set to 0 to disable. This is a band-aid solution if constantly swallowing/spitting out allies feels like an abuse of game mechanics. Alternatively, use Regurgitation Hunger.
Preds are unable to swallow prey for a number of turn after regurgitation. Set to 0 to disable
Determines how far prey spawn when regurgitated.
If the hunger mechanic is enabled and this is greater than 0, you will recieve this amount of hunger stacks after regurgitating a living prey, per prey. Alternative to Regurgitation Cooldown
Increases / reduces the size of all bellies. Default is 100%
The % chance of a gurgle being played every 6 seconds (a turn). Set to 0 to disable.

Reloads the config for bellies for custom races from the currently saved CustomRacesBellies.json (if it exists) Normally it's loaded when you load a save, but this option allows you to manually reload it.
Access debug options. Do not check this unless you know what you're doing.

Check this to reset vore. All preds will regurgitate everything and the stored data will be cleared. Wait until it's ready before clicking again. If it's not switching back to Ready after 2-3 seconds, check Console for errors.
If true, all vore attempts will result in a success.
Locks 'stomach item' that is used to store items during item vore.

Determines if a living prey is teleported to their predator at the end of each turn (or every 6 seconds outside of turn-based mode). By default is on, should be only turned off in case of performance issues
Shows a tab with some WIP options. Most of them work just fine, but use them at your own risk.
Enables you to swallow items. They will be stored inside a locked container in your inventory. Items can be digested is your stomach start digesting prey. Digested items are permanently lost!
When you start digesting prey, the items in your stomach might be digested. WARNING: THIS WILL DELETE STORY ITEMS IN YOUR STOMACH AND COULD SOFTLOCK YOUR SAVE

Stores and adds fat value to belly size. Fat is increased during digestion of dead prey and reduced upon resting. This is here, because it ONLY affects the belly size, so some people found it confusing.
% of a prey's weight you gain as fat.
How much fat a character loses on long resting.
How much fat a character loses on short resting.
If set to true, while you have fat, it will be consumed to reduce hunger gain by half
Swallowing a prey will make the predator sweaty for a couple of turns. IDK why this has been removed from the main options.
These loci will receive bonuses from feats (like prey being able to cast spells while inside this locus)
By checking this, you assert that you have read any and all information available on the wiki.
Digesting allies will heal them for [1] instead of dealing damage. This passive can be toggled off.
You are covered by healing acid! You regain [1] each turn.
Start a dialogue with a random prey inside you.
Moves all your preys from one organ into a different organ.
Use this to start a Long Rest while a player character is devoured. A confirmation window will appear on screen. You must click 'yes' within a couple of seconds, or the potion will not work.
